alert.note: Alert for Hartford; Middlesex (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:19PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hartford and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Middle Haddam, Northampton, Hartford, Thompsonville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Hartford. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Flooding affects some residential areas below Hartford through Rocky Hill, including some roadways. Upstream of Hartford, flooding is likely to affect Windsor Locks, East Windsor and Windsor. Should localized evacuations be necessary, act quickly. Further downstream flooding will likely result in the evacuation of low lying area along River Road in Cromwell and Meadow Road in Portland. Flooding increases from Middletown and Portland to the river mouth at Old Saybrook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 13.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue rising to a crest of 22.4 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.4 feet on 05/29/1877. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at noon EST.
